security: Disclosing the alias documents and operational methods utilized by CIA officers could compromise ongoing operations and endanger personnel. The document details alias identities and specific documents used for operational purposes, like Social Security cards, club memberships, and credentials. For example, it lists, “CIA Credential #1716”, “(Mexican) Passport in the alias of Diego S. MARDONES MARTINEZ)”, etc., which, if revealed, could lead to the identification and targeting of current or former agents.
summary: A memorandum detailing the return of alias documents issued to a retiring CIA officer, including credentials, social security cards, and a Mexican passport, for final disposition.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, dated July 16, 1975, from Joseph F. King, Chief of LA Security, to CCS/PRG, concerns the return of alias documents previously used by a CIA officer (David Morales), who is retiring on July 31, 1975. The documents, which include credentials, Social Security cards, club memberships, and a Mexican passport under various aliases such as Miguel P. COSSIO, Diego S. MARDONES, and Daniel Suarez MORENO, are being returned for final disposition. The memo also notes that a Mexican passport in the alias of Diego S. MARDONES MARTINEZ is currently held by the officer on TDY in Buenos Aires, Argentina and will be retrieved upon his return to Headquarters.
tags: John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
title: Return of Alias Documents
sender: Joseph F. King, Chief, LA Security
